result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:50 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bridget M Borland in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Bridget M Borland.  Atty. Nimmer provides an update, she was able to confirm the defendant is being revoked and is asking for a plea and sentencing date in mid to late November.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:20 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bridget M Borland in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Bridget M Borland.  Atty. Nimmer provides an update, she notes her client is currently on a Probation hold and needs more time to see what will happen with everything now.  Atty. Nimmer requests a further proceedings date in 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

ADDRESS INFO for Bridget M Borland
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: W243 N3351 Deer Park Drive Unit 8, Pewaukee, WI 53072
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:11 AM Defendant Bridget M Borland in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
